abstract: A politically connected California investment firm was drawn further into New York State’s pension fund corruption investigation on Tuesday after a former employee pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor related to securities fraud.
snippet: A politically connected California investment firm was drawn further into New York State’s pension fund corruption investigation on Tuesday after a former employee pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor related to securities fraud.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:47 p.m. A politically connected California investment firm was drawn further into New York State’s pension fund corruption investigation on Tuesday after a former employee pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor related to securities fraud, The New York Times’s Danny Hakim reports from Albany.

headline.main: California Firm Is Pulled Into N.Y. Pension Inquiry
